attributes.name: Reflexes
attributes.description: Measure of balance, limberness, quickness, and full-body motor abilities.

skills.name: Acrobatics
skills.description: Performing feats of gymnastics, extraordinary balance, and dance (and related performance arts), as well as break falls. Useful for running obstacle courses or doing water ballet.

skills.name: Brawling
skills.description: Competence in unarmed combat.

skills.name: Climbing
skills.description: Scaling various surfaces.

skills.name: Contortion
skills.description: Escaping from otherwise secure physical bonds by twisting, writhing, and contorting the body.

skills.name: Dodge
skills.description: Slipping out of danger’s way, whether avoiding an attack or a sprung booby trap.

skills.name: Flying
skills.description: Maneuvering under one’s own power (such as with wings) or in null gravity.

skills.name: Jumping
skills.description: Leaping over obstacles.

skills.name: Melee Combat
skills.description: Wielding hand-to-hand weapons.

skills.name: Riding
skills.description: Controlling and riding domesticated mounts.

skills.name: Sneak
skills.description: Moving silently and avoiding detection, whether through shadows or crowds.

attributes.name: Coordination
attributes.description: Measure of hand-eye coordination and fine motor abilities.

skills.name: Lockpicking
skills.description: Opening a mechanical (not electronic) lock or safe without possessing the key or combination, as well as disarming small mechanical traps.

skills.name: Marksmanship
skills.description: Shooting guns of any type. Covers everything from small slugthrowers to vehicle-mounted rockets.

skills.name: Missile Weapons
skills.description: Firing unpowered ranged weapons.

skills.name: Piloting
skills.description: Operating any kind of vehicle or powered armor traveling on or through the ground, a liquid medium, the air, or space.

skills.name: Sleight of Hand
skills.description: Nimbleness with the fingers and misdirection, including picking pockets, palming items, and stage magic.

skills.name: Throwing
skills.description: Hitting a target accurately with a thrown item, including grenades, stones, and knives. Also used for catching thrown items. (Using or modifying grenades as explosives for special destructive effects requires the demolitions skill.)

attributes.name: Physique
attributes.description: Measure of physical power and ability to resist damage.

skills.name: Lifting
skills.description: Moving or lifting heavy objects, as well as representing the ability to inflict additional damage with strength-powered weapons.

skills.name: Running
skills.description: Moving quickly on the ground while avoiding obstacles and keeping from stumbling.

skills.name: Stamina
skills.description: Physical endurance and resistance to pain, disease, and poison.

skills.name: Swimming
skills.description: Moving and surviving in a liquid medium.

attributes.name: Knowledge
attributes.description: Measure of strength of memory and ability to learn.

skills.name: Business
skills.description: Comprehension of business practices and the monetary value of goods and opportunities, including the ability to determine how to make money with another skill the character has. Business can complement charm, con, and persuasion when haggling over prices for goods and services being bought or sold.

skills.name: Demolitions
skills.description: Using corrosives and explosives to achieve particular destructive effects.

skills.name: Forgery
skills.description: Creating and noticing false or altered documentation in various media (paper, electronic, plastic card, etc.), including counterfeiting, though tasks may require other skills to help detect or make the forgery.

skills.name: Languages
skills.description: Familiarity with and ability to use various forms of communication, including written, spoken, and nonverbal. Characters may choose one “native” language in which they have written and spoken fluency. Additional languages in which a character has proficiency can be represented by specializations of this skill.

skills.name: Medicine
skills.description: Using first aid techniques to treat injuries, as well as an understanding and application of medical procedures, including diagnosing illnesses and performing surgery.

skills.name: Navigation
skills.description: Determining the correct course using external reference points, such as stars, maps, or landmarks, as well as creating maps.

skills.name: Scholar
skills.description: This skill represents knowledge and/or education in areas not covered under any other skill (such as chemistry, mathematics, archeology, interior design, etc.). This may be restricted to a specific field (represented by specializations) or a general knowledge of a wide range of subjects. It is used to remember details, rumors, tales, legends, theories, important people, and the like, as appropriate for the subject in question. However, the broader the category, the fewer the details that can be recalled. It covers what the character himself can recall. Having another skill as a specialization of the scholar skill means that the character knows the theories and history behind the skill but can’t actually use it. It can be useful with investigation to narrow a search for information.

skills.name: Security
skills.description: Installing, altering, and bypassing electronic security and surveillance systems.

skills.name: Tech
skills.description: Using and designing (not making) complex mechanical or electronic equipment, such as programming and operating computers and manipulating communication devices.

attributes.name: Perception
attributes.description: Measure of mental quickness and attention to detail.

skills.name: Artist
skills.description: Making works of art, like paintings, photographs, and music or literary compositions.

skills.name: Gambling
skills.description: Playing and cheating at games of strategy and luck.

skills.name: Hide
skills.description: Concealing objects, both on oneself and using camouflage.

skills.name: Investigation
skills.description: Gathering information, researching topics, analyzing data, and piecing together clues.

skills.name: Know-how
skills.description: Ability to figure out how to perform an action in which the character does not have experience, as well as a catch-all skill encompassing areas not covered by other skills (such as basic, not fancy, sewing or cooking).

skills.name: Repair
skills.description: Creating, fixing, or modifying gadgets, weapons, armor, and vehicles.

skills.name: Search
skills.description: Spotting hidden objects or people, reconnoitering, lipreading, or eavesdropping on or watching another person.streetwise: Finding information, goods, and contacts in an urban environment, particularly through criminal organizations, black markets, and other illicit operations. Also useful for determining possible motives and methods of criminals.

skills.name: Survival
skills.description: Surviving in wilderness environments.

skills.name: Tracking
skills.description: Following the trail of another person, animal, or creature, or keeping after a moving target without being noticed.

attributes.name: Presence
attributes.description: Measure of emotional strength, physical attractiveness, and personality.

skills.name: Animal Handling
skills.description: Controlling animals and making them perform tricks and follow commands.

skills.name: Charm
skills.description: Using friendliness, flattery, or seduction to influence someone else. Also useful in business transactions, putting on performances (such as singing, acting, or storytelling), and situations involving etiquette.

skills.name: Command
skills.description: Effectively ordering and coordinating others in team situations.

skills.name: Con
skills.description: Bluffing, lying, tricking, or deceiving others, as well as verbal evasiveness, misdirection, and blustering. Also useful in putting on acting performances.

skills.name: Disguise
skills.description: Altering features or clothing to be unrecognizable or to look like someone else. Also useful in acting performances.

skills.name: Intimidation
skills.description: Using physical presence, verbal threats, taunts, torture, or fear to influence others or get information out of them.

skills.name: Persuasion
skills.description: Influencing others or getting information out of them through bribery, honest discussion, debate, diplomacy, or speeches. Also useful in negotiations, business transactions, and put-ting on performances (such as singing, acting, or storytelling).

skills.name: Willpower
skills.description: Ability to withstand stress, temptation, other people’s interaction attempts, mental attacks, and pain. The Game Master may allow a specialization in a specific faith tradition or belief system to enhance many, though not all, applications of willpower.

attributes.name: Magic
attributes.description: Magic is the ability to manipulate the paranormal forces of the universe for extraordinary effects.

skills.name: Alteration
skills.description: Casting spells involving change.

skills.name: Apportation
skills.description: Casting spells involving movement.

skills.name: Conjuration
skills.description: Casting spells involving creation.

skills.name: Divination
skills.description: Casting spells involving knowledge.

attributes.name: Psionics
attributes.description: Magic is the ability to manipulate the paranormal forces of the universe for extraordinary effects.

skills.name: Astral Projection
skills.description: The ability to leave one’s body.

skills.name: Empathy
skills.description: The ability to sense emotions.

skills.name: Far-sensing
skills.description: The ability to use one’s senses at a distance.

skills.name: Healing
skills.description: The ability to heal injuries with the mind.

skills.name: Medium
skills.description: The ability to speak with the spirits of the dead.

skills.name: Protection
skills.description: The ability to psychically defend against injury.

skills.name: Psychometry
skills.description: The ability to sense information about a person, place, or event by looking at an object connected to it.

skills.name: Strike
skills.description: The ability to psychically cause injury.

skills.name: Telekinesis
skills.description: The ability to move things with the mind.

skills.name: Telepathy
skills.description: The ability to read thoughts.
